name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Lucerne

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first trip to Europe featured 2 nights at the Radission Blu prior to departing on a Viking River Cruise. The hotel was modern and much more sophisticated than we imagined. The power to the room was controlled by the insertion of your room key into a master power slot by the door. The window shades were power operated, the bed was comfortable (firm) and the bathroom was modern and clean. Fast and modern WiFi was available as you might expect in a civilized country such as CH. We were pleased to have access to an honor bar, a safe and above-average TV options. The staff were fluent in any language you can imagine and we heard multiple languages and dialects during our stay. The walk to the old-town or to the Lake was short and the property is next to the train station. This nice property made our stay in Lucerne a pleasant one and we enjoyed the opportunity to walk anywhere in just a few minutes. The food was fine and the bar-beverage service was outstanding! Any travel to Lucerne should include the Radisson Blu!
reviews.title: Great People and a Great Property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night while visiting Lucerne. The hotel is located just a very short walk form the train station, making it very convenient without having to take a taxi. It is also close to the lakeside, boats and the Chapel Bridge.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in good location
Really good
reviews.text: The rooms are nice and comfortable with all the amenities we needed. They also had available free Wifi which was also nice since many hotels charge for this.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was also very quiet, probably because it was located in a quiet part of a business district and not near loud bars or restaurants.
reviews.title: Lakeside delight

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting Lucerne.
reviews.title: Good location-air conditioned!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay there for two nights in August. The check-in was very smooth and we received a free upgrade to a junior suite (thank you for that). The breakfast was good and the overall service was what you do except for an hotel of this standing. The health club was closed and it would have been nice to have an email warning us about this before our travel.
reviews.title: Good hotel but some improvements could be done

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two small negative comments, the bed in the junior suite was big (which was great) but the duvet was not meant for this size of bed. Our first night was not as could as it could have been and after having request a second small duvet all was in order. The bar service in the evening was slow (when a staff member was at the bar) and we had to go somewhere else when two buses of tourist arrived as the hotel staff where completely swamped.
reviews.title: A disappointment

reviews.text: Will we come back? yes definitely as the hotel is very well situated and overall is very good
reviews.title: You Get What you Pay For

reviews.text: We were allocated this hotel as an extension after a wonderful Viking River Cruise from Amsterdam to Basel.
reviews.title: Breakfast of champions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we eventually checked in we were told that we had been upgraded to a Business room from a Lake View room. However our Business room appeared to not be ready. There were several problems: the Minibar was empty, the carpeted floor had obviously not been cleaned, with several long blonde hairs visable, an obvious layer of dust on all surfaces (i.e. the bedside tables, the areas around the windows and the shelving around and below the safe, a half empty bottle of water under the bed one side and an empty packet the other, only one wine glass, no whitener/milk for the tea/coffee, a broken table and poor drainage in the bathroom sink and tub, large greasy marks/hand prints on the inside window over-looking the lake and a drawer containing currency and plastic cutlery obviously left by a previous occupant. Most of these problems were reported to the reception desk the first night of our stay as we went out to dinner. When we left two days later the only thing that had been rectified was the Minibar.
reviews.title: very good hotel
Great Location
reviews.text: Stayed one night in Lucerne and chose the Radisson Blu based on the recommendations. As others have stated, it is very convenient to the train station as well as to walking the city. Several nice restaurants close by and very friendly service. I was treated to a nice room with a large Japanese-style soaking tub with separate shower and tons of space. The view was not the best - railroad tacks - but I wasn't in the room much anyway given the beauty of Lucerne. I would definitely stay at this property again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is hardly 500 mtr from Lucerne Train Station, so one can just walk to reach. As the hotel is adjoining station i can't say that it is the best of the location, I would have preferred something on the lakeside. The rooms are very good & spacious & bathroom is good. You have a free working wifi. We reached around 11:00 am at the hotel, & we were not allocated a room because hotel check-in time is 14:00 hrs. I had sent request for early check-in many days before but it didn't help. We planned to visit Titlis the same day, so we had to freshen up in the lobby toilet which didn't feel good. to reach the city centre you have to walk back to the train station from where one can hop on to a bus. The breakfast is very good & has plenty of options. The good thing is you have a air conditioned room for a very hot climate in july.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel - Decent Stay

reviews.text: We chose to stay at the Radisson Blu due to it's proximity to the train station. It is an easy walk of 5-10 minutes and although it is set slightly away from Chapel Bridge and historic town centre it's no more than a 10 minute walk. The room is everything you can expect in a good business hotel - very nice, but nothing different or special. Great to come back to a lovely air conditioned room after a very hot day!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The first room that we were assigned had a large tub that was 3 ft. high and very difficult to get into for a shower. I'm a senior citizen and this was a dangerous situation for me. There were no handicap rooms available. Talked with front desk and were reassigned another room with a walk in shower. However, the drain was directly under the shower faucet and did not drain well. The bathroom was totally flooded after one shower, leaving the floor very slippery. The decor was modern scandinavian and very uncomfortable. The cards did not work in the elevator. Just another aggravation!
reviews.title: Not Comfortable!
Great Location
reviews.text: This hotel is central to most of the action. It lies 8 minutes walk from the main railway station virtually on the banks of Lake Lucerne. It doesn't come cheap and frankly the breakfast price is a 'rip-off' but it has all features one expects from a modern hotel not to mention the 'Radisson' brand.

I loved this hotel! The view was fabulous! I walked into my room, dropped my bags and started taking pictures out the window. Then I turned around and looked at the room: It was great! The room was big, the bathroom was big, and it was air conditioned! Lots of little extras that were great, too. We ate in the hotel at the buffet for breakfast and at night, and it was really good food. This hotel was the best!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel decor is very contemporary - inside and out. Your room key controls the lighting. Lots of horizontal surfaces to hold open luggage. Plenty of storage space if you need it. We were disappointed with the bathroom. Although it looked great, the faucet in the sink made the water splash everywhere, and the shower in the tub sprayed onto the floor. The bathtub must be designed for Europeans - too deep and too long for a nice soak. The breakfast buffet was included and of excellent quality including yoghurt, fruit, eggs, pastries, and made-to-order omelettes, pancakes and waffles. Located near the KKLM centre and the railway station, it was a noisy and busy area for the 75th anniversary festivities. Face cloths and adapters available for the asking. We discovered that the Swiss do not use ice in their drinks, preferring their water cool not cold. Free WIFI available in your room using your own devices.
reviews.title: contemporary hotel
